main_definition: To set or keep apart from a larger group; not to be mixed with others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To divide into different parts or pieces.
meanings_and_examples.example: The cake was separated into eight equal slices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not related; not connected in any way.
meanings_and_examples.example: His opinions are separate from his political affiliation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move apart or distance oneself from someone else.
meanings_and_examples.example: After the argument, she decided to separate herself from him for a while.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To treat as different; not to include in one group with others of the same kind.
meanings_and_examples.example: The store has two sections: children's and adult clothing, so they are separated by age groups.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not to consider or associate oneself with a certain thing or person.
meanings_and_examples.example: I chose not to separate my personal life from work matters.
